question: I have
answers: I have one or two particular best friends.
I have several friends who I would call best friends.
I have have nobody who I would call a best friend.

question: The most important thing about a friendship is
answers: Having somebody to confide in.
Having somebody to have fun with.

question: If I had to pick, I would rather have a friend who
answers: Who enjoys doing the same things as me than a friend who feels the same way about life as I do.
Who feels the same way about life as I do, than a friend who enjoys doing the same things as me.

question: I like to
answers: Be close to people.
Keep my distance from people.

question: When I talk with friends on the phone, it is usually
answers: When I talk with friends on the phone, it is usually to make arrangements rather than to chat.
When I talk with friends on the phone, it is usually to chat rather than to make arrangements.

question: I tend to
answers: I tend to think of an activity I want to do and then find somebody to do it with.
I tend to arrange to meet somebody and then think of something to do.

question: I prefer meeting a friend for a
answers: I prefer meeting a friend for a specific activity, e.g. going to the cinema, playing golf.
I prefer meeting a friend for a chat, e.g. at a pub, at a caf√©.

question: If I moved to a new area, I would put more effort into
answers: Staying in touch with old friends than making new friends.
Making new friends than staying in touch with old friends.

question: My friends value me more as someone
answers: Who is a support to them than as someone to have fun with.
To have fun with than as someone who is a support to them.

question: If a friend had a problem, I would be better at
answers: Discussing their feelings about the problem than coming up with practical solutions.
Coming up with practical solutions than discussing their feelings about the problem.

question: If a friend was having personal problems, I would
answers: Wait for them to contact me as I wouldn't want to interfere.
Contact them to discuss the problem.

question: When I have a personal problem, I feel that it is better to
answers: Work it out on my own.
Share it with a friend.
Try and forget about it.

question: If I have to say something critical to a friend
answers: I think it's best to broach the subject gently.
I think it's best to just come right out and say it.

question: If I fell out with a good friend and I thought that I hadn't done anything wrong, I would
answers: Do whatever it takes to repair the relationship.
Be willing to make the first move, as long as they reciprocated.
Be willing to sort out the problem, if they made the first move.
Not feel able to be their close friend anymore.

question: My ideal working space would be
answers: In an office on my own, without any visitors during the day.
In an office on my own, with an occasional visitor during the day.
In an office with one or two others.
In an open plan office.
